body: Occurred in #29213, might have a chance of actually being caused by that.
No, seems like a genuine failure, cannot reproduce it locally.

body:
Extra info: it seems the timeout happens terminating the [`systemB-rebuild`](https://github.com/akka/akka/blob/c287fff034b598c06ef87bda78dc9851a51da94f/akka-remote/src/test/scala/akka/remote/artery/tcp/ssl/RotatingKeysSSLEngineProviderSpec.scala#L45-L66):

```
[WARN] [06/14/2020 20:57:55.953] [pool-1-thread-1-ScalaTest-running-RotatingProviderWithStaticKeysSpec] [akka.remote.RemoteActorRefProvider] Akka Cluster not in use - Using Akka Cluster is recommended if you need remote watch and deploy.
[info] - must keep existing connections alive (no new SSLEngine's created after cache expiration) (2 seconds, 671 milliseconds)
[info] akka.remote.artery.tcp.ssl.RotatingProviderWithStaticKeysSpec *** ABORTED *** (15 seconds, 316 milliseconds)
[info]   java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: Future timed out after [10 seconds]

...

[info]   at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
[WARN] [06/14/2020 20:58:08.639] [systemB-rebuild-akka.actor.internal-dispatcher-29] [CoordinatedShutdown(akka://systemB-rebuild)] Coordinated shutdown phase [actor-system-terminate] timed out after 10000 milliseconds
```

issue.title: Cleanup list of used systems

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
References #29221

the failure is not a test but a `It is not a test it is a sbt.testing.SuiteSelector`. I suspect the suite selector there is not running any code but still tries to invoke `afterTermination` and sees the collection of actor systems.

body: A sibling test failed here with similar stacktrace: https://jenkins.akka.io:8498/job/pr-validator-per-commit-jenkins/20142/
(not entirely confident that we found the real cause, but let's close this until it pops up again :crossed_fingers: )
